projects.title: Transfer of DNA Bar-coding technology for genetic inventory and identification of rare and endangered species
projects.description: The project aims to assist Belarus to develop technical capacity to undertake inventories and identification of rare and endangered species using modern molecular genetic technologies, such as DNA- barcoding. The activities will include: (i) a regional training course on the practical use of the DNA barcoding technology for taxonomy; and (ii) establishment of a regional reference library of DNA barcodes for rare and endangered species; and (iii) development of a Regional Collaborative Network for strengthening of inter-institutional capacities for taxonomic research, inventory and monitoring of rare and endangered species at the regional level.
projects.proponent: Institute of Genetics and Cytology of the National Academy of Sciences

projects.title: Protecting Traditional Knowledge with Defensive Strategy and Research of Access and Benefit-Sharing Model Contract in China.
projects.description: This project aims to support the inventory and documentation of traditional knowledge associated with biological and genetic resources in a pilot minority area in China, compilation of case studies on the exploitation and utilization of traditional knowledge in China and conduct of pre-research on an ABS Model Contract between China’s local people holding traditional knowledge and China’s bio-industrial business which use it. These activities response to the need to encourage conservation of biocultural diversity and to increase effectiveness in management of traditional knowledge held by IPLCs and foster cooperation between providers and users of genetic resources.
projects.proponent: Nanjing Institute of Environmental Sciences, Ministry of Environmental Protection of the People’s Republic of China (NIES)

projects.title: Cooperation for  Development of Ecosystem-Natural Capital Accounts in Anglophone West-African Countries
projects.description: The project aims at developing human resource capacity in Ghana and other Anglophone countries in the sub-region to undertake proper valuation of their natural resources and natural capital accounting. This is intended to help these countries to carry out efficient assessments to support national and sub-regional development and take full account of the contribution of natural resources and ecosystem services in the national accounting systems.
projects.proponent: Ministry of Environment, Science, Technology and Innovation (MESTI)

projects.title: Cooperation on Biodiversity Data Management for Species and Ecosystem Assessments
projects.description: This project will facilitate cooperation between Colombia, Brazil and South Africa to enhance biodiversity data management for species and ecosystem assessments. It will help to develop tools and enhance the adoption of standards for compiling and making available existing en Recursos Biológicos Alexander von Humboldt
projects.providerOfAssistance: Instituto de Investigación en Recursos Biológicos Alexander von Humboldt

projects.title: Asian big cat's conservation through technology sharing and the use of unified DNA typing methodology
projects.description: The project aims to the capacity of countries to promote the conservation of the Asian Big Cats (tiger, lion, leopard, snow leopard, and clouded leopard) through the use of genetic technologies to combat poaching and illegal wildlife trade. It will assist countries to establish wildlife genetics facilities in regional institutes and build capacity to adopt consistent methodology and protocols for genetic characterization of wild populations, a prerequisite for identification of the geographic origin of the wildlife seizures.

projects.title: Integrating biodiversity values into national, sectoral and local development policies and plans in Malawi and Mozambique
projects.description: Integrating biodiversity values into national, sectoral and local development policies and plans in Malawi and Mozambique
collaborators: Environment and Rural Development of Mozambique

projects.title: Establishment of a Legal Leadership Programme in Morocco and French-speaking African countries
projects.description: This project will help build up a coalition of countries willing to take up a leadership role in designing ABS legislative, administrative and policy measures. Morocco, which is developing national legal capacity on ABS issues, will offer long-term legal leadership and support to Francophone countries to make advancements in designing and implementing ABS legislative measures. The program will collaborate other leading countries globally, e.g. Brazil, Ecuador, Malaysia, etc.) National legal trainers will be trained to lead and guide the organization of trainings and the development of training manuals and materials in their respective countries.

projects.title: Identification of Orchid Species and Techniques for Reproduction and In Vitro Culture
projects.description: The project will contribute to strengthening the capacities of the Ministry’s technical staff and local communities in terms of conservation, production and sustainable use of orchids with a view to diminishing the impact generated by illegal harvesting in the wild and to repopulating areas affected by it. It will involve organization of workshops and lectures on the topics of orchid identification, conservation, artificial reproduction, in vitro cultivation, and sustainable exploitation. This will be complemented by study tours and visits to nurseries, research and educational centres, areas of illegal harvesting, and communities with established experience in sustainable use of orchids.
projects.proponent: Venezuela - Ministry of People’s Power for Ecosocialism and Water

projects.title: Transfer of DNA bar-coding technology for biodiversity monitoring
projects.description: This project aims to develop the capacity of Vietnam and other Asian countries to use the DNA bar-coding technology for the identification and analysis of threatened species, invasive alien species, and species subject to illegal trafficking.

projects.title: Development of a genetic fingerprinting database of Zimbabwe`s biodiversity: DNA barcoding of alien and endangered species.
projects.description: The project aims to develop the capacity of Zimbabwe to establish biodiversity bioinformatics repositories and use genetic fingerprints of biotraded genetic resources, invasive alien species and endangered species. Genetic repositories will enable a country to specifically identify native species using molecular information and techniques such as DNA barcoding in order to unlock the true commercial value of its genetic resources. The implementation of the project shall be done in phases.
